ACT
202
Temporary measures
Before starting the probate procedure and during it, until the procedure is legally concluded, the court, at the request of the party, in order to secure things and rights from the probate, will order temporary measures provided for in the Enforcement Act, if the party makes it probable that the existing situation would change without such a measure, or if it makes it likely that the measure is necessary to prevent violence or the occurrence of threatened irreparable harm.
